page.title: 18EDUCATION IN ROMSLEY/HUNN.
page.content: 'Old School House'used to be school until 1850's,when a school was built by the church.This became Church Hall when church built a new school in 1913 which became Controlled in 1961 and LEA rebuilt it adding classrooms and kitchen The original building became hall.Number of pupils rose ;two huts added in '66 and two class rooms and staffroom in'68.Reached peak of almost 300 children and nine staff in 1972. Became 9-10First Sch. Older children continued transfer to Halesowen Sch's. In 1977 became 5-9 First School and children now go on to Hagley Middle and Haybridge High in Hagley 6 miles away.Present staffing Head+2 with 70 pupils.Good parent support with fund raising,help with swimming,recorders and craft groups.Except Parish C'nl., Guides and jumble sales school is not used by community.Charges too high.
